20101225021555.000|20101225021605.000|TR0|L. KING:  For many of you watching, "The 
20101225021605.000|20101225021615.000|TR0|Night Before Christmas" is a story that 
20101225021615.000|20101225021625.000|TR0|parents read to you on Christmas Eve.  And 
20101225021625.000|20101225021635.000|TR0|now you read it to your own children.  But 
20101225021635.000|20101225021644.000|TR0|I'll bet you've never heard it read like 
20101225021644.000|20101225021654.000|TR0|this.  Queen Latifah puts her own spin on 
20101225021654.000|20101225021704.000|TR0|the classic as she reads to children from 
20101225021704.000|20101225021714.000|TR0|the Milton Hershey School.
20101225021714.000|20101225021723.000|TR0|

20101225021733.000|20101225021743.000|TR0|Christmas story called "The Night Before 
20101225021743.000|20101225021753.000|TR0|Christmas."  Are you with it, kids?  All 
20101225021753.000|20101225021803.000|TR0|right, here we go.  'Twas the night before 
20101225021803.000|20101225021812.000|TR0|Christmas when all through the house, not 
20101225021812.000|20101225021822.000|TR0|a creature was stirring, not even a mouse. 
20101225021822.000|20101225021832.000|TR0| The stockings were hung by the chimney 
20101225021832.000|20101225021842.000|TR0|with care, in hopes that St. Nicholas soon 
20101225021842.000|20101225021852.000|TR0|would be there.
20101225021852.000|20101225021901.000|TR0|

20101225021911.000|20101225021921.000|TR0|their beds, while visions of sugarplums 
20101225021921.000|20101225021931.000|TR0|danced in their heads.  Sugarplums, nice.  
20101225021931.000|20101225021940.000|TR0|And mama in her kerchief, and I in my cap, 
20101225021940.000|20101225021950.000|TR0|had just settled down for a long winter's 
20101225021950.000|20101225022000.000|TR0|nap.
20101225022000.000|20101225022010.000|TR0|
20101225022010.000|20101225022020.000|TR0|When out on the lawn there arose such a 
20101225022020.000|20101225022029.000|TR0|clatter, I sprang from the bed to see what 
20101225022029.000|20101225022039.000|TR0|was the matter.  Away to the window, I 
20101225022039.000|20101225022049.000|TR0|flew like a flash, tore open the shutters 
20101225022049.000|20101225022059.000|TR0|and threw up the sash.  The moon on the 
20101225022059.000|20101225022109.000|TR0|breast of the new-fallen snow gave a 
20101225022109.000|20101225022118.000|TR0|luster of midday to objects below.  When 
20101225022118.000|20101225022128.000|TR0|what to my wandering eye should appear but 
20101225022128.000|20101225022138.000|TR0|a miniature sleigh and eight tiny reindeer.
20101225022138.000|20101225022148.000|TR0|
20101225022148.000|20101225022157.000|TR0|With a little old driver, so lively and 
20101225022157.000|20101225022207.000|TR0|quick, I knew in a moment it must be St. 
20101225022207.000|20101225022217.000|TR0|Nick.  More rapid than eagles his courses 
20101225022217.000|20101225022227.000|TR0|they came, and he whistled and shouted and 
20101225022227.000|20101225022237.000|TR0|called them by name.  Now Dasher! Now 
20101225022237.000|20101225022246.000|TR0|Dancer! Now Prancer! Now Vixen! On Comet, 
20101225022246.000|20101225022256.000|TR0|on Cupid, on Donner and Blitzen.  To the 
20101225022256.000|20101225022306.000|TR0|top of the porch, to the top of the wall.  
20101225022306.000|20101225022316.000|TR0|Now dash away, dash away, dash away all.
20101225022316.000|20101225022325.000|TR0|
20101225022325.000|20101225022335.000|TR0|As dry leaves that before the wild 
20101225022335.000|20101225022345.000|TR0|hurricane fly, when they meet with an 
20101225022345.000|20101225022355.000|TR0|obstacle, mount to the sky.  So up to the

20101225022405.000|20101225022414.000|TR0|sleigh fall of toys, and St. Nicholas too. 
20101225022414.000|20101225022424.000|TR0| And then, in a twinkling, I heard on the 
20101225022424.000|20101225022434.000|TR0|roof the prancing and pawing of each 
20101225022434.000|20101225022444.000|TR0|little hoof. As I drew in my head, and was

20101225022454.000|20101225022503.000|TR0|Nicholas came with a bound.

20101225024003.000|20101225024013.000|TR0|of my favorite Christmas memories are just 
20101225024013.000|20101225024023.000|TR0|with family.  That has always been a big 
20101225024023.000|20101225024033.000|TR0|thing for any holiday, especially the 
20101225024033.000|20101225024042.000|TR0|holiday seasons.  It is being able to 
20101225024042.000|20101225024052.000|TR0|spend time with my family.  And I was -- I 
20101225024052.000|20101225024102.000|TR0|would be little.  We would go Christmas 
20101225024102.000|20101225024112.000|TR0|caroling, my brothers and sisters and 
20101225024112.000|20101225024122.000|TR0|cousins, and just go with the Santa hats 
20101225024122.000|20101225024131.000|TR0|around, singing Christmas songs.
20101225024131.000|20101225024141.000|TR0|
20101225024141.000|20101225024151.000|TR0|And we also used to perform as a family at 
20101225024151.000|20101225024201.000|TR0|like retirement homes and hospitals.  And 
20101225024201.000|20101225024211.000|TR0|those are just -- those are some of my 
20101225024211.000|20101225024220.000|TR0|favorite memories we had, being able to 
20101225024220.000|20101225024230.000|TR0|give back to other people, in any way we 
20101225024230.000|20101225024240.000|TR0|can.  I mean, like we -- I didn't feel 
20101225024240.000|20101225024250.000|TR0|like I could do much for other people, but 
20101225024250.000|20101225024259.000|TR0|music was always something I felt we could 
20101225024259.000|20101225024309.000|TR0|give back.
